complete_sentence: Non ce la faccio più a sopportare questo rumore continuo.
question_text: Non ___ faccio più a sopportare questo rumore continuo.
english_translation: I can't stand this continuous noise anymore.
explanation: The verb 'farcela' means 'to manage/cope' and requires the pronouns 'ce la' with the verb fare. It's a common pronominal verb in Italian.

complete_sentence: Il riscaldamento globale rappresenta una delle sfide più urgenti del nostro tempo.
question_text: Il riscaldamento globale rappresenta una delle ___ più urgenti del nostro tempo.
english_translation: Global warming represents one of the most urgent challenges of our time.
explanation: In environmental discourse, 'sfida' (challenge) is the most appropriate term when discussing global issues that require collective action and solutions.

complete_sentence: Quando avrò finito gli studi, cercherò lavoro all'estero.
question_text: Quando ___ finito gli studi, cercherò lavoro all'estero.
english_translation: When I will have finished my studies, I'll look for work abroad.
explanation: The futuro anteriore (future perfect) is used to express an action that will be completed before another future action. It's formed with the future of avere/essere + past participle.

complete_sentence: Il sistema sanitario pubblico garantisce assistenza medica gratuita a tutti i cittadini.
question_text: Il sistema sanitario pubblico ___ assistenza medica gratuita a tutti i cittadini.
english_translation: The public healthcare system guarantees free medical care to all citizens.
explanation: In the context of healthcare systems, 'garantire' (to guarantee) is the most precise verb to express the institutional commitment to providing services.

complete_sentence: Pur essendo molto stanco, ha continuato a lavorare fino a tardi.
question_text: Pur ___ molto stanco, ha continuato a lavorare fino a tardi.
english_translation: Despite being very tired, he continued working until late.
explanation: The construction 'pur + gerundio' expresses concession ('despite/although'). The gerund 'essendo' is used with the connector 'pur' to create this meaning.

complete_sentence: Pensavo che tu fossi già partito per le vacanze.
question_text: Pensavo che tu ___ già partito per le vacanze.
english_translation: I thought you had already left for vacation.
explanation: After 'pensavo che' (past opinion), the congiuntivo imperfetto is required. 'Fossi' is the imperfect subjunctive of 'essere' used with the past participle 'partito'.

complete_sentence: La mamma ha fatto riparare la lavatrice dal tecnico.
question_text: La mamma ha fatto ___ la lavatrice dal tecnico.
english_translation: Mom had the washing machine repaired by the technician.
explanation: The causative construction 'fare + infinitive' expresses having someone else do something. The infinitive form 'riparare' follows directly after 'fare'.

complete_sentence: Se avessi studiato di più, avresti superato l'esame facilmente.
question_text: Se avessi studiato di più, ___ superato l'esame facilmente.
english_translation: If you had studied more, you would have passed the exam easily.
explanation: In hypothetical statements about the past (third conditional), the main clause uses the condizionale passato. 'Avresti' is the conditional perfect of 'avere' used with the past participle.

complete_sentence: Non se ne va mai prima delle otto di sera.
question_text: Non ___ va mai prima delle otto di sera.
english_translation: He/She never leaves before eight in the evening.
explanation: The pronominal verb 'andarsene' (to go away/leave) requires the reflexive pronoun 'se' followed by the particle 'ne'. The correct order is 'se ne' before the conjugated verb.

complete_sentence: Il riscaldamento globale avrà causato danni irreversibili entro il 2050.
question_text: Il riscaldamento globale ___ causato danni irreversibili entro il 2050.
english_translation: Global warming will have caused irreversible damage by 2050.
explanation: The futuro anteriore (future perfect) is formed with the future tense of avere/essere + past participle. It expresses an action that will be completed before a specific point in the future.

complete_sentence: Bisogna ridurre le emissioni di CO2 per combattere il cambiamento climatico.
question_text: Bisogna ridurre le ___ di CO2 per combattere il cambiamento climatico.
english_translation: We need to reduce CO2 emissions to fight climate change.
explanation: In environmental contexts, 'emissioni' refers to the release of gases or pollutants into the atmosphere. This is the correct term for CO2 emissions in climate change discussions.

complete_sentence: Il sistema sanitario pubblico garantisce cure gratuite a tutti i cittadini.
question_text: Il sistema sanitario pubblico garantisce cure ___ a tutti i cittadini.
english_translation: The public health system guarantees free healthcare to all citizens.
explanation: The adjective 'gratuito' must agree with the feminine plural noun 'cure', therefore it becomes 'gratuite'.

complete_sentence: Studiando ogni giorno, riuscirà sicuramente a superare l'esame.
question_text: ___ ogni giorno, riuscirà sicuramente a superare l'esame.
english_translation: By studying every day, he/she will surely pass the exam.
explanation: The gerund (gerundio presente) 'studiando' expresses the means or manner by which the main action will be accomplished. It corresponds to 'by + -ing' in English.

complete_sentence: Ha fatto riparare la macchina dal meccanico.
question_text: Ha ___ riparare la macchina dal meccanico.
english_translation: He/She had the car repaired by the mechanic.
explanation: The causative construction 'fare + infinitive' means to have something done by someone else. When conjugated in compound tenses, 'fare' becomes 'fatto' while the following verb remains in the infinitive.

complete_sentence: Avrei preferito che mi avesse chiamato prima.
question_text: ___ preferito che mi avesse chiamato prima.
english_translation: I would have preferred that he/she had called me earlier.
explanation: The condizionale passato (conditional perfect) is formed with the conditional of avere/essere + past participle. It expresses a past action that would have happened under certain conditions or a polite preference about the past.

complete_sentence: Marco se ne va sempre prima della fine delle riunioni.
question_text: Marco ___ sempre prima della fine delle riunioni.
english_translation: Marco always leaves before the end of meetings.
explanation: The pronominal verb 'andarsene' means 'to go away/leave' and requires both reflexive pronoun 'se' and partitive pronoun 'ne'.

complete_sentence: Il riscaldamento globale rappresenta la più grave minaccia ambientale del nostro secolo.
question_text: Il riscaldamento globale rappresenta la più grave ___ del nostro secolo.
english_translation: Global warming represents the most serious environmental threat of our century.
explanation: In environmental debate vocabulary, 'minaccia ambientale' (environmental threat) is the precise term for discussing climate change impacts.

complete_sentence: Quando avrò finito questo progetto, potrò finalmente rilassarmi.
question_text: Quando ___ questo progetto, potrò finalmente rilassarmi.
english_translation: When I have finished this project, I will finally be able to relax.
explanation: The futuro anteriore (future perfect) 'avrò finito' expresses a future action that will be completed before another future action.

complete_sentence: Il nuovo sistema sanitario dovrebbe garantire cure gratuite a tutti i cittadini.
question_text: Il nuovo sistema sanitario dovrebbe garantire ___ a tutti i cittadini.
english_translation: The new healthcare system should guarantee free treatment to all citizens.
explanation: In healthcare and society vocabulary, 'cure gratuite' (free treatment/care) refers to universal healthcare access.

complete_sentence: Il professore ci ha fatto ripetere l'esercizio tre volte.
question_text: Il professore ci ha fatto ___ l'esercizio tre volte.
english_translation: The teacher made us repeat the exercise three times.
explanation: The causative construction 'fare + infinitive' expresses 'to make/have someone do something' and requires the bare infinitive.

complete_sentence: Avresti dovuto chiamarmi prima di venire qui.
question_text: ___ chiamarmi prima di venire qui.
english_translation: You should have called me before coming here.
explanation: The condizionale passato 'avresti dovuto' expresses obligation or necessity that was not fulfilled in the past ('should have').

complete_sentence: Da giovane sognava di diventare chirurgo e salvare vite umane.
question_text: Da giovane sognava di diventare ___ e salvare vite umane.
english_translation: When he was young, he dreamed of becoming a surgeon and saving human lives.
explanation: With masculine subject 'Da giovane' referring to a male person, the profession chirurgo remains masculine singular.

complete_sentence: L'avvocatessa ha difeso il cliente con grande competenza durante il processo.
question_text: L'___ ha difeso il cliente con grande competenza durante il processo.
english_translation: The female lawyer defended the client with great competence during the trial.
explanation: The feminine form 'avvocatessa' is used for female lawyers, agreeing with the feminine article 'l''.

complete_sentence: Il nuovo ponte viene costruito da un'impresa specializzata.
question_text: Il nuovo ponte ___ costruito da un'impresa specializzata.
english_translation: The new bridge is being built by a specialized company.
explanation: The passive voice can be formed with 'venire' + past participle, emphasizing the action in progress.

complete_sentence: Per ottenere il permesso di soggiorno, devi presentare tutti i documenti richiesti in questura.
question_text: Per ottenere il permesso di soggiorno, devi presentare tutti i documenti richiesti in ___.
english_translation: To obtain the residence permit, you must submit all required documents at the police station.
explanation: The questura (police station) is where foreigners must apply for residence permits in Italy.

complete_sentence: La prego di inviarmi i documenti il prima possibile, grazie.
question_text: ___ prego di inviarmi i documenti il prima possibile, grazie.
english_translation: Please send me the documents as soon as possible, thank you.
explanation: In formal situations, 'La prego' is used to address someone politely with the Lei form.

complete_sentence: L'intelligenza artificiale solleva importanti questioni sulla privacy dei dati personali.
question_text: L'intelligenza artificiale solleva importanti questioni sulla ___ dei dati personali.
english_translation: Artificial intelligence raises important questions about personal data privacy.
explanation: Privacy is the most common term used in Italian when discussing data protection and artificial intelligence.

complete_sentence: Speravo che tu avessi capito l'importanza di questo progetto.
question_text: Speravo che tu ___ capito l'importanza di questo progetto.
english_translation: I hoped that you had understood the importance of this project.
explanation: After 'speravo che' (past tense), the congiuntivo passato 'avessi capito' is required for past actions.

complete_sentence: Credo che abbiano già preso una decisione definitiva.
question_text: Credo che ___ già preso una decisione definitiva.
english_translation: I believe they have already made a final decision.
explanation: After 'credo che' (present tense), the congiuntivo passato 'abbiano preso' expresses a completed action.

complete_sentence: Dubito che sia riuscito a completare tutto il lavoro in tempo.
question_text: Dubito che ___ riuscito a completare tutto il lavoro in tempo.
english_translation: I doubt that he managed to complete all the work on time.
explanation: After 'dubito che' (doubt), the congiuntivo passato 'sia riuscito' is used for completed past actions.

complete_sentence: Il mio sogno è diventare ingegnere aerospaziale e lavorare per l'ESA.
question_text: Il mio sogno è diventare ___ aerospaziale e lavorare per l'ESA.
english_translation: My dream is to become an aerospace engineer and work for ESA.
explanation: The noun 'ingegnere' remains masculine even when referring to a female engineer in traditional usage, though 'ingegnera' is increasingly accepted.

complete_sentence: Il documento viene firmato dal direttore ogni mattina.
question_text: Il documento ___ firmato dal direttore ogni mattina.
english_translation: The document is signed by the director every morning.
explanation: The passive voice can be formed with 'venire' + past participle, emphasizing the action or process rather than the state.

complete_sentence: Per rinnovare il passaporto, devo presentare tutti i documenti richiesti in questura.
question_text: Per rinnovare il passaporto, devo presentare tutti i documenti ___ in questura.
english_translation: To renew my passport, I must present all the required documents at the police station.
explanation: The past participle 'richiesti' agrees with the masculine plural noun 'documenti' when used as an adjective.

complete_sentence: La prego di inviarmi una conferma scritta entro venerdì prossimo.
question_text: ___ prego di inviarmi una conferma scritta entro venerdì prossimo.
english_translation: Please send me written confirmation by next Friday.
explanation: In formal contexts, 'La prego' (with capital L) is the polite form to address someone respectfully using the Lei form.

complete_sentence: Questo social network raccoglie troppi dati personali senza il nostro consenso esplicito.
question_text: Questo social network raccoglie troppi ___ personali senza il nostro consenso esplicito.
english_translation: This social network collects too much personal data without our explicit consent.
explanation: In technology contexts, 'dati' is the standard term for 'data,' especially when referring to personal information.

complete_sentence: Spero che abbiate capito l'importanza di questa decisione.
question_text: Spero che ___ capito l'importanza di questa decisione.
english_translation: I hope you (plural) understood the importance of this decision.
explanation: After 'sperare che' expressing hope about a past action, use the congiuntivo passato: auxiliary verb in congiuntivo presente + past participle.

complete_sentence: È possibile che sia già arrivato a destinazione.
question_text: È possibile che ___ già arrivato a destinazione.
english_translation: It's possible that he has already arrived at his destination.
explanation: Expressions of possibility like 'è possibile che' require the congiuntivo. For recent past actions, use congiuntivo passato: sia/abbia + past participle.

complete_sentence: Penso che abbiano fatto bene a cambiare strategia.
question_text: Penso che ___ fatto bene a cambiare strategia.
english_translation: I think they did well to change strategy.
explanation: The verb 'pensare che' requires the subjunctive mood. For completed past actions, use congiuntivo passato: abbiano + past participle.

complete_sentence: Da ingegnere biomedico, sviluppo dispositivi che migliorano la qualità della vita dei pazienti.
question_text: Da ___ biomedico, sviluppo dispositivi che migliorano la qualità della vita dei pazienti.
english_translation: As a biomedical engineer, I develop devices that improve patients' quality of life.
explanation: In Italian, 'ingegnere' remains unchanged in gender and is used for both male and female engineers in professional contexts.

complete_sentence: La psicologa forense analizza il comportamento criminale per aiutare nelle indagini giudiziarie.
question_text: La ___ forense analizza il comportamento criminale per aiutare nelle indagini giudiziarie.
english_translation: The forensic psychologist analyzes criminal behavior to help in judicial investigations.
explanation: The feminine form 'psicologa' agrees with the feminine article 'la' and refers specifically to a female psychologist.

complete_sentence: Credo che sia stato licenziato per aver violato il regolamento aziendale.
question_text: Credo che ___ stato licenziato per aver violato il regolamento aziendale.
english_translation: I believe he was fired for violating company regulations.
explanation: The congiuntivo passato 'sia stato' is used after 'credo che' to express a belief about a completed past action.

complete_sentence: Dubito che abbiano già approvato la sua domanda di cittadinanza.
question_text: Dubito che ___ già approvato la sua domanda di cittadinanza.
english_translation: I doubt they have already approved his citizenship application.
explanation: The congiuntivo passato 'abbiano approvato' is required after 'dubito che' when expressing doubt about a completed action.

complete_sentence: Suppongo che si siano trasferiti in un'altra città per motivi di lavoro.
question_text: Suppongo che ___ trasferiti in un'altra città per motivi di lavoro.
english_translation: I suppose they moved to another city for work reasons.
explanation: The congiuntivo passato 'si siano trasferiti' is used after 'suppongo che' with reflexive verbs to express supposition about past actions.

complete_sentence: Questi documenti vengono elaborati dal sistema informatico automaticamente.
question_text: Questi documenti ___ elaborati dal sistema informatico automaticamente.
english_translation: These documents are processed by the computer system automatically.
explanation: The passive with 'venire' emphasizes the process or action being performed, particularly suitable with ongoing or repeated actions.

complete_sentence: Per rinnovare il permesso di soggiorno devo presentare tutta la documentazione entro la scadenza.
question_text: Per rinnovare il permesso di soggiorno devo ___ tutta la documentazione entro la scadenza.
english_translation: To renew the residence permit I must submit all the documentation before the deadline.
explanation: In bureaucratic contexts, 'presentare documentazione' is the standard formal expression for submitting official documents.

complete_sentence: Le scrivo per informarla dell'esito della sua candidatura al nostro programma di formazione.
question_text: ___ scrivo per informarla dell'esito della sua candidatura al nostro programma di formazione.
english_translation: I am writing to you to inform you of the outcome of your application to our training program.
explanation: In formal correspondence, 'Le' is used as the indirect object pronoun with the formal 'Lei' form.

complete_sentence: L'intelligenza artificiale solleva questioni etiche riguardo la privacy dei dati personali.
question_text: L'intelligenza artificiale ___ questioni etiche riguardo la privacy dei dati personali.
english_translation: Artificial intelligence raises ethical questions regarding personal data privacy.
explanation: 'Sollevare questioni' is the idiomatic Italian expression for 'to raise questions' in formal and academic contexts.

complete_sentence: Se avessi studiato di più, avresti superato l'esame senza problemi.
question_text: Se avessi studiato di più, ___ superato l'esame senza problemi.
english_translation: If you had studied more, you would have passed the exam without problems.
explanation: In the third conditional (periodo ipotetico del terzo tipo), the main clause uses the conditional perfect 'avresti superato'.

complete_sentence: Mi ha detto che sarebbe arrivato entro le otto di sera.
question_text: Mi ha detto che ___ arrivato entro le otto di sera.
english_translation: He told me that he would arrive by eight in the evening.
explanation: After a past reporting verb 'mi ha detto', future actions are expressed with the conditional 'sarebbe'.

complete_sentence: I mezzi pubblici elettrici riducono l'inquinamento atmosferico nelle città.
question_text: I mezzi pubblici elettrici riducono l'___ atmosferico nelle città.
english_translation: Electric public transportation reduces atmospheric pollution in cities.
explanation: Inquinamento atmosferico (atmospheric pollution) is the environmental impact reduced by electric public transport.

complete_sentence: È importante che tutti rispettino le regole del condominio.
question_text: È importante che tutti ___ le regole del condominio.
english_translation: It's important that everyone respects the building rules.
explanation: After 'è importante che', the present subjunctive 'rispettino' is required.

complete_sentence: Benché il tempo sia brutto, usciremo lo stesso.
question_text: Benché il tempo ___ brutto, usciremo lo stesso.
english_translation: Although the weather is bad, we'll go out anyway.
explanation: After 'benché' (although), the present subjunctive 'sia' is always required.

complete_sentence: L'opera lirica italiana ha influenzato profondamente la musica classica mondiale.
question_text: L'opera ___ italiana ha influenzato profondamente la musica classica mondiale.
english_translation: Italian opera has profoundly influenced world classical music.
explanation: Opera lirica specifically refers to operatic art form, distinguishing it from other musical genres.

complete_sentence: Le chiedo gentilmente di confermare la sua partecipazione all'evento.
question_text: ___ chiedo gentilmente di confermare la sua partecipazione all'evento.
english_translation: I kindly ask you to confirm your participation in the event.
explanation: In formal contexts, 'Le chiedo' uses the indirect object pronoun for the Lei form.

complete_sentence: L'azienda ha lanciato una nuova piattaforma di e-commerce per espandere il mercato online.
question_text: L'azienda ha lanciato una nuova ___ di e-commerce per espandere il mercato online.
english_translation: The company launched a new e-commerce platform to expand the online market.
explanation: Piattaforma di e-commerce refers to an online platform or system for conducting electronic commerce.

complete_sentence: L'azienda ha investito molto denaro a causa della crescente concorrenza nel mercato.
question_text: L'azienda ha investito molto denaro ___ della crescente concorrenza nel mercato.
english_translation: The company invested a lot of money because of the growing competition in the market.
explanation: The complex preposition 'a causa di' means 'because of' and indicates a causal relationship.

complete_sentence: Il governo ha approvato una nuova legge per la tutela dei diritti dei consumatori.
question_text: Il governo ha approvato una nuova legge per la ___ dei diritti dei consumatori.
english_translation: The government approved a new law for the protection of consumer rights.
explanation: In legal contexts, 'tutela' is the specific term for legal protection or safeguarding of rights.

complete_sentence: La nostra startup ha lanciato una piattaforma di e-commerce innovativa.
question_text: La nostra ___ ha lanciato una piattaforma di e-commerce innovativa.
english_translation: Our startup launched an innovative e-commerce platform.
explanation: The term 'startup' is commonly used in Italian business contexts to refer to new technology companies.

complete_sentence: Il nostro fatturato è aumentato del venti percento rispetto all'anno scorso.
question_text: Il nostro ___ è aumentato del venti percento rispetto all'anno scorso.
english_translation: Our turnover increased by twenty percent compared to last year.
explanation: In business Italian, 'fatturato' specifically refers to turnover or total revenue, distinct from profit ('profitto').

complete_sentence: Mi ha detto che sarebbe venuto alla festa se avesse avuto tempo.
question_text: Mi ha detto che ___ venuto alla festa se avesse avuto tempo.
english_translation: He told me that he would have come to the party if he had had time.
explanation: In indirect speech, the conditional tense is maintained when reporting what someone said they would do.

complete_sentence: Con più tempo a disposizione, avrei organizzato meglio il progetto.
question_text: Con più tempo a disposizione, ___ organizzato meglio il progetto.
english_translation: With more time available, I would have organized the project better.
explanation: The condizionale passato (would have + past participle) is formed with the conditional of avere/essere + past participle.

complete_sentence: Se fossi stato più attento, non avrei commesso quell'errore.
question_text: Se fossi stato più attento, non ___ commesso quell'errore.
english_translation: If I had been more careful, I wouldn't have made that mistake.
explanation: In hypothetical past situations (periodo ipotetico del terzo tipo), the main clause uses condizionale passato.

complete_sentence: Credo che Marco sia già partito.
question_text: Credo che Marco ___ già partito.
english_translation: I think Marco has already left.
explanation: The verb 'credere' (to believe) expresses an opinion, which requires the subjunctive. To refer to a completed past action, the past subjunctive (congiuntivo passato) is used, formed with the present subjunctive of 'essere' + the past participle: 'sia partito'.

complete_sentence: Temo che abbiano sbagliato strada.
question_text: Temo che ___ sbagliato strada.
english_translation: I'm afraid they took the wrong road.
explanation: The verb 'temere' (to fear) expresses an emotion, which requires the subjunctive. For a completed past action, the past subjunctive (congiuntivo passato) 'abbiano sbagliato' is the correct form.

complete_sentence: È possibile che non abbia ricevuto il messaggio.
question_text: È possibile che non ___ il messaggio.
english_translation: It's possible he didn't receive the message.
explanation: The impersonal expression 'È possibile che' expresses uncertainty and requires the subjunctive. For a completed past action, the past subjunctive (congiuntivo passato) 'abbia ricevuto' is the correct form.

complete_sentence: Spero che tu abbia fatto bene il lavoro.
question_text: Spero che ___ bene il lavoro.
english_translation: I hope you did the work well.
explanation: Verbs of hope like 'sperare' require the subjunctive. To refer to a past action, the past subjunctive (congiuntivo passato) is used: 'abbia fatto'.

complete_sentence: Dubito che abbia capito tutto quello che dice.
question_text: Dubito che ___ tutto quello che dice.
english_translation: I doubt he understood everything he says.
explanation: The verb 'dubitare' (to doubt) expresses uncertainty and therefore requires the subjunctive. The past subjunctive 'abbia capito' is used to express doubt about a completed past action.

complete_sentence: Mi sembra che abbia cantato molto bene.
question_text: Mi sembra che ___ molto bene.
english_translation: It seems to me that she sang very well.
explanation: The impersonal expression 'mi sembra che' (it seems to me) conveys a subjective opinion and requires the subjunctive. For a past action, the past subjunctive 'abbia cantato' is used.

complete_sentence: Non credo che abbiano letto tutto il libro.
question_text: Non credo che ___ tutto il libro.
english_translation: I don't think they read the whole book.
explanation: Expressing a negative opinion with 'non credo che' requires the subjunctive. The past subjunctive 'abbiano letto' is used to refer to the completed past action of reading.

complete_sentence: È probabile che sia arrivato in ritardo.
question_text: È probabile che ___ in ritardo.
english_translation: It's probable that he arrived late.
explanation: The expression 'È probabile che' indicates probability, not certainty, and therefore requires the subjunctive. The past subjunctive 'sia arrivato' is used for the completed past action.

complete_sentence: Ho l'impressione che non abbia capito niente.
question_text: Ho l'impressione che non ___ niente.
english_translation: I have the impression that he didn't understand anything.
explanation: Subjective expressions like 'Ho l'impressione che' require the subjunctive. The past subjunctive 'abbia capito' is used to express an impression about a past event.

complete_sentence: Penso che tu abbia fatto una buona scelta.
question_text: Penso che ___ una buona scelta.
english_translation: I think you made a good choice.
explanation: The verb 'pensare' (to think), when expressing a subjective opinion, requires the subjunctive. The past subjunctive 'tu abbia fatto' is used to refer to a choice made in the past.

complete_sentence: È impossibile che abbia detto la verità.
question_text: È impossibile che ___ la verità.
english_translation: It's impossible that he told the truth.
explanation: Expressions of impossibility, such as 'È impossibile che', require the subjunctive mood. The past subjunctive 'abbia detto' is used for the past action of telling.

complete_sentence: Pare che abbia fatto un errore.
question_text: Pare che ___ un errore.
english_translation: It seems he made a mistake.
explanation: The impersonal expression 'pare che' (it seems that) expresses an opinion and requires the subjunctive. 'Abbia fatto' is the correct past subjunctive form.

complete_sentence: Sembra che siano tornati a casa presto.
question_text: Sembra che ___ a casa presto.
english_translation: It seems they went home early.
explanation: The expression 'Sembra che' (It seems that) requires the subjunctive mood. Since 'tornare' uses 'essere' as its auxiliary, the correct past subjunctive is 'siano tornati'.

complete_sentence: Credo che abbia comprato la macchina nuova.
question_text: Credo che ___ la macchina nuova.
english_translation: I think he bought the new car.
explanation: The verb 'credere' (to believe) expresses a personal opinion and requires the subjunctive. For a past action, the past subjunctive 'abbia comprato' is the correct form.

complete_sentence: È strano che non abbia chiamato ancora.
question_text: È strano che non ___ ancora.
english_translation: It's strange that he hasn't called yet.
explanation: Expressions of personal feeling like 'È strano che' require the subjunctive. The past subjunctive 'abbia chiamato' is used for a past event.

complete_sentence: Magari potessi venire anch'io!
question_text: Magari ___ venire anch'io!
english_translation: If only I could come too!
explanation: The word 'Magari' is used with the imperfect subjunctive (congiuntivo imperfetto) to express a strong, often unrealistic, wish. 'Potessi' is the imperfect subjunctive of 'potere'.

complete_sentence: Ovunque tu vada, ti seguirò.
question_text: Ovunque tu ___, ti seguirò.
english_translation: Wherever you go, I'll follow you.
explanation: Indefinite adverbs of place like 'ovunque' (wherever) introduce a generalized, hypothetical situation and require the present subjunctive, 'vada'.

complete_sentence: Chiunque voglia può partecipare.
question_text: Chiunque ___ può partecipare.
english_translation: Anyone who wants can participate.
explanation: The indefinite pronoun 'chiunque' (whoever) refers to a non-specific person and thus requires the subjunctive mood. 'Voglia' is the present subjunctive of 'volere'.

complete_sentence: Qualsiasi cosa succeda, sarò con te.
question_text: Qualsiasi cosa ___, sarò con te.
english_translation: Whatever happens, I'll be with you.
explanation: The indefinite expression 'qualsiasi cosa' (whatever) introduces a hypothetical situation and must be followed by the present subjunctive, 'succeda'.

complete_sentence: Benché sia ricco, è molto avaro.
question_text: Benché ___ ricco, è molto avaro.
english_translation: Although he's rich, he's very stingy.
explanation: Concessive conjunctions like 'benché' (although), which introduce a contrasting statement, always require the subjunctive. 'Sia' is the present subjunctive of 'essere'.

complete_sentence: Purché arrivi in orario, va bene.
question_text: Purché ___ in orario, va bene.
english_translation: As long as you arrive on time, it's fine.
explanation: The conjunction 'purché' (as long as) introduces a condition and must be followed by the subjunctive. 'Arrivi' is the present subjunctive form for 'tu'.

complete_sentence: Senza che nessuno se ne accorga, è scappato.
question_text: Senza che nessuno se ne ___, è scappato.
english_translation: Without anyone noticing, he escaped.
explanation: The conjunction 'senza che' (without) requires the subjunctive. 'Accorga' is the present subjunctive of the reflexive verb 'accorgersi'.

complete_sentence: Nonostante abbia poco, è molto generoso.
question_text: Nonostante ___ poco, è molto generoso.
english_translation: Despite having little, he's very generous.
explanation: 'Nonostante' (despite) is a concessive conjunction that always requires the subjunctive mood. 'Abbia' is the present subjunctive of 'avere'.

complete_sentence: Ammesso che tu abbia ragione, cosa facciamo?
question_text: Ammesso che ___ ragione, cosa facciamo?
english_translation: Assuming you're right, what do we do?
explanation: The expression 'Ammesso che' (assuming that) introduces a hypothesis and requires the subjunctive. 'Tu abbia' is the correct present subjunctive form.

complete_sentence: Caso mai tu abbia bisogno, chiamami.
question_text: Caso mai ___ bisogno, chiamami.
english_translation: In case you need anything, call me.
explanation: The expression 'Caso mai' (in case) introduces a potential situation and must be followed by the subjunctive. 'Tu abbia' is the present subjunctive of 'avere'.

complete_sentence: Prima che sia troppo tardi, dobbiamo agire.
question_text: Prima che ___ troppo tardi, dobbiamo agire.
english_translation: Before it's too late, we must act.
explanation: Temporal clauses introduced by 'prima che' (before) always require the subjunctive because they refer to an action that has not yet happened. 'Sia' is the present subjunctive of 'essere'.

complete_sentence: Finché non riceva i documenti, non posso partire.
question_text: Finché non ___ i documenti, non posso partire.
english_translation: Until I receive the documents, I can't leave.
explanation: The expression 'finché non' (until) introduces a future condition. When the main clause is in the present, the subordinate clause uses the present subjunctive 'riceva' to indicate this future uncertainty.

complete_sentence: Nel caso in cui ci siano problemi, avvisami.
question_text: Nel caso in cui ___ problemi, avvisami.
english_translation: In case there are problems, let me know.
explanation: The expression 'Nel caso in cui' (in case) introduces a hypothetical possibility and must be followed by the subjunctive. 'Ci siano' is the present subjunctive form of 'esserci'.

complete_sentence: È l'unico che sappia la verità.
question_text: È l'unico che ___ la verità.
english_translation: He's the only one who knows the truth.
explanation: Relative clauses that depend on an expression of uniqueness (like 'l'unico') require the subjunctive. 'Sappia' is the present subjunctive of 'sapere'.

complete_sentence: Non c'è nessuno che possa aiutarmi.
question_text: Non c'è nessuno che ___ aiutarmi.
english_translation: There's nobody who can help me.
explanation: Negative expressions like 'non c'è nessuno che' require the subjunctive because they refer to something non-existent or uncertain. 'Possa' is the present subjunctive of 'potere'.

complete_sentence: Cerco una persona che sappia parlare cinese.
question_text: Cerco una persona che ___ parlare cinese.
english_translation: I'm looking for someone who can speak Chinese.
explanation: When the antecedent in a relative clause is indefinite ('una persona' - a person, not a specific one), the subjunctive is used to indicate uncertainty. 'Sappia' is the present subjunctive of 'sapere'.

complete_sentence: È il film più bello che abbia mai visto.
question_text: È il film più bello che ___ mai visto.
english_translation: It's the most beautiful film I've ever seen.
explanation: Relative clauses following a superlative expression ('il più bello che') require the subjunctive. Here, 'abbia' is the auxiliary for the implied past subjunctive 'abbia mai visto'.

complete_sentence: Che io sappia, non è ancora arrivato.
question_text: Che io ___, non è ancora arrivato.
english_translation: As far as I know, he hasn't arrived yet.
explanation: 'Che io sappia' is a fixed phrase meaning 'As far as I know', using the present subjunctive to indicate the speaker's knowledge may be incomplete.

complete_sentence: Per quanto riesca a studiare, non capisco.
question_text: Per quanto ___ studiare, non capisco.
english_translation: No matter how much I study, I don't understand.
explanation: The concessive conjunction 'per quanto' (no matter how much) requires the subjunctive mood. In this case, 'riesca'.

complete_sentence: Dovunque vada, trovo sempre problemi.
question_text: Dovunque ___, trovo sempre problemi.
english_translation: Wherever I go, I always find problems.
explanation: The indefinite adverb 'dovunque' (wherever) introduces a generalized, hypothetical location and must be followed by the subjunctive 'vada'.

complete_sentence: Se avessi studiato di più, ora sarei medico.
question_text: Se avessi studiato di più, ora ___ medico.
english_translation: If I had studied more, I would now be a doctor.
explanation: This is a mixed conditional sentence. It describes a hypothetical past condition ('Se avessi studiato' - congiuntivo trapassato) that has a consequence in the present, which requires the present conditional ('sarei').

complete_sentence: Se non fosse piovuto, saremmo andati al mare.
question_text: Se non fosse piovuto, ___ al mare.
english_translation: If it hadn't rained, we would have gone to the beach.
explanation: This is a Type 3 conditional sentence (unreal past). The structure is: 'Se' + pluperfect subjunctive ('fosse piovuto') + past conditional ('saremmo andati').

complete_sentence: Se farà bel tempo domani, andremo in montagna.
question_text: Se ___ bel tempo domani, andremo in montagna.
english_translation: If it's nice weather tomorrow, we'll go to the mountains.
explanation: This is a Type 1 conditional sentence (real possibility). It refers to a real possibility in the future and uses the future indicative in both the 'if' clause ('farà') and the main clause.

complete_sentence: Se avessi saputo prima, ti avrei chiamato.
question_text: Se ___ prima, ti avrei chiamato.
english_translation: If I had known earlier, I would have called you.
explanation: This is a Type 3 conditional sentence (unreal past). The 'if' clause describes an unreal past condition and requires the pluperfect subjunctive (congiuntivo trapassato), 'avessi saputo'.

complete_sentence: Se tu mi avessi ascoltato, non saremmo qui.
question_text: Se tu mi ___ ascoltato, non saremmo qui.
english_translation: If you had listened to me, we wouldn't be here.
explanation: This is a mixed conditional sentence. A hypothetical past condition ('Se tu mi avessi ascoltato' - congiuntivo trapassato) has a result in the present, which requires the present conditional ('non saremmo qui').

complete_sentence: Se avessi più tempo, finirei il lavoro.
question_text: Se ___ più tempo, finirei il lavoro.
english_translation: If I had more time, I would finish the work.
explanation: This is a Type 2 conditional sentence (hypothetical present/future). The structure is: 'Se' + imperfect subjunctive ('avessi') + present conditional ('finirei').

complete_sentence: Se danno questo film, non andrò al cinema.
question_text: Se ___ questo film, non andrò al cinema.
english_translation: If they're showing this movie, I won't go to the cinema.
explanation: This is a Type 1 conditional sentence (real possibility). For a real condition in the present, the structure is: 'Se' + present indicative ('danno') + future simple ('andrò').

complete_sentence: Se fossi ricco, aiuterei molte persone.
question_text: Se ___ ricco, aiuterei molte persone.
english_translation: If I were rich, I would help many people.
explanation: This is a Type 2 conditional sentence (hypothetical present). The 'if' clause requires the imperfect subjunctive (congiuntivo imperfetto) of 'essere', which is 'fossi'.

complete_sentence: Se fossi vissuto in Italia, avresti imparato l'italiano.
question_text: Se ___ in Italia, avresti imparato l'italiano.
english_translation: If you had lived in Italy, you would have learned Italian.
explanation: This is a Type 3 conditional sentence (unreal past). The 'if' clause needs the pluperfect subjunctive (congiuntivo trapassato). For 'vivere', which uses 'essere', this is 'fossi vissuto'.

complete_sentence: Se avessi potuto, sarei venuto.
question_text: Se ___ potuto, sarei venuto.
english_translation: If I could have, I would have come.
explanation: This is a Type 3 conditional sentence with the modal verb 'potere'. The 'if' clause requires the pluperfect subjunctive (congiuntivo trapassato) of the modal verb, which is 'avessi potuto'.

complete_sentence: Se domani ci sarà sole, faremo il picnic.
question_text: Se domani ___ sole, faremo il picnic.
english_translation: If it's sunny tomorrow, we'll have a picnic.
explanation: This is a Type 1 conditional sentence (real future possibility). It uses the future tense in both the 'if' clause ('ci sarà') and the main clause ('faremo').

complete_sentence: Se non fossi così testardo, capiresti.
question_text: Se non ___ così testardo, capiresti.
english_translation: If you weren't so stubborn, you would understand.
explanation: This is a Type 2 conditional sentence (hypothetical present). The structure is 'Se' + imperfect subjunctive ('fossi') + present conditional ('capiresti').

complete_sentence: Se avesse preso quella strada, sarebbe arrivato prima.
question_text: Se ___ quella strada, sarebbe arrivato prima.
english_translation: If he had taken that road, he would have arrived earlier.
explanation: This is a Type 3 conditional sentence (unreal past). The 'if' clause must be in the pluperfect subjunctive (congiuntivo trapassato), 'avesse preso'.

complete_sentence: Quando avrò finito, ti chiamerò.
question_text: Quando ___ finito, ti chiamerò.
english_translation: When I've finished, I'll call you.
explanation: The future perfect (futuro anteriore), 'avrò finito', is used in a temporal clause with 'quando' to describe a future action that will be completed before another future action ('ti chiamerò').

complete_sentence: Appena sarà arrivato, cominceremo.
question_text: Appena ___ arrivato, cominceremo.
english_translation: As soon as he arrives, we'll start.
explanation: In a temporal clause with 'appena' (as soon as), the future perfect (futuro anteriore), 'sarà arrivato', indicates the action that must be completed before the second action ('cominceremo') can begin.

complete_sentence: Dopo che avremo mangiato, usciremo.
question_text: Dopo che ___ mangiato, usciremo.
english_translation: After we've eaten, we'll go out.
explanation: The expression 'dopo che' (after) introduces a future action that precedes another. The first action takes the future perfect ('avremo mangiato'), and the second takes the simple future ('usciremo').

complete_sentence: Non appena avrò ricevuto la lettera, partirò.
question_text: Non appena ___ la lettera, partirò.
english_translation: As soon as I receive the letter, I'll leave.
explanation: To describe a sequence of future events, the action that happens first is put in the future perfect (futuro anteriore). The action of receiving ('avrò ricevuto') must happen before the action of leaving ('partirò').

complete_sentence: Quando saranno arrivati tutti, inizieremo la riunione.
question_text: Quando ___ tutti, inizieremo la riunione.
english_translation: When everyone has arrived, we'll start the meeting.
explanation: To express a sequence of future actions, the first completed action uses the future perfect (futuro anteriore). 'Saranno arrivati' must happen before the meeting can start ('inizieremo').

complete_sentence: Una volta che avremo organizzato tutto, ci riposeremo.
question_text: Una volta che ___ tutto, ci riposeremo.
english_translation: Once we've organized everything, we'll rest.
explanation: The expression 'una volta che' (once) introduces a condition that must be met in the future before another action. The first action takes the future perfect ('avremo organizzato'), and the subsequent action takes the simple future.

complete_sentence: Avrei dovuto studiare di più.
question_text: ___ dovuto studiare di più.
english_translation: I should have studied more.
explanation: The past conditional (condizionale passato) is formed with the present conditional of the auxiliary verb + the past participle. 'Avrei dovuto' is used to express regret about a past action that did not happen.

complete_sentence: Sarei venuto, ma ero malato.
question_text: ___ venuto, ma ero malato.
english_translation: I would have come, but I was sick.
explanation: The past conditional 'Sarei venuto' expresses an action that would have happened in the past under different circumstances. The verb 'venire' uses 'essere' as its auxiliary.

complete_sentence: Non avrei mai fatto una cosa del genere.
question_text: Non ___ mai fatto una cosa del genere.
english_translation: I would never have done such a thing.
explanation: The past conditional 'avrei fatto' is used to state what one would have done in a hypothetical past situation.

complete_sentence: Loro sarebbero partiti prima.
question_text: Loro ___ partiti prima.
english_translation: They would have left earlier.
explanation: This sentence describes an unrealized past possibility and requires the past conditional (condizionale passato). 'Partire' requires the auxiliary 'essere', so the correct form is 'sarebbero partiti'.

complete_sentence: Tu avresti potuto evitarlo.
question_text: Tu ___ potuto evitarlo.
english_translation: You could have avoided it.
explanation: The past conditional of the modal verb 'potere' ('avresti potuto') is used to talk about a past possibility that was not realized, often implying criticism or regret.

complete_sentence: Lei sarebbe dovuta andare dal dottore.
question_text: Lei ___ dovuta andare dal dottore.
english_translation: She should have gone to the doctor.
explanation: When a modal verb like 'dovere' is used with a verb that takes 'essere' (like 'andare'), the auxiliary is usually 'essere'. 'Sarebbe dovuta andare' expresses an unfulfilled past obligation.

complete_sentence: Mi ha detto che sarebbe venuto.
question_text: Mi ha detto che ___ venuto.
english_translation: He told me he would come.
explanation: This is reported speech (discorso indiretto). When the main verb is in the past ('ha detto'), a future action from the original speech ('Verrò') changes to the past conditional ('sarebbe venuto'). This is called 'future in the past'.

complete_sentence: Ha spiegato che non aveva tempo.
question_text: Ha spiegato che non ___ tempo.
english_translation: He explained that he didn't have time.
explanation: In reported speech with a past reporting verb ('ha spiegato'), the present indicative from the original speech ('Non ho tempo') changes to the imperfect indicative ('aveva').

complete_sentence: Mi ha chiesto se stessi bene.
question_text: Mi ha chiesto se ___ bene.
english_translation: He asked me if I was feeling well.
explanation: Indirect questions introduced by 'se' require the imperfect subjunctive (congiuntivo imperfetto) when the main verb is in the past ('ha chiesto'). 'Stessi' is the congiuntivo imperfetto of 'stare'.

complete_sentence: Ha detto che era già partito.
question_text: Ha detto che ___ già partito.
english_translation: He said he had already left.
explanation: In reported speech, when the reporting verb is in the past ('Ha detto'), an action already completed at that time (original speech: 'È già partito') is reported using the pluperfect indicative (trapassato prossimo), 'era già partito'.

complete_sentence: Gli ho domandato se potesse aiutarmi.
question_text: Gli ho domandato se ___ aiutarmi.
english_translation: I asked him if he could help me.
explanation: This is an indirect question with a past main verb ('ho domandato'). The verb in the 'se' clause must be in the imperfect subjunctive (congiuntivo imperfetto). 'Potesse' corresponds to the original 'Puoi aiutarmi?'.

complete_sentence: Ha promesso che sarebbe arrivato in orario.
question_text: Ha promesso che ___ in orario.
english_translation: He promised he would arrive on time.
explanation: This reports a future promise from a past perspective ('ha promesso'). The original statement 'Arriverò in orario' (future) becomes 'sarebbe arrivato' (past conditional) in reported speech.

complete_sentence: Mi ha detto di stare tranquillo.
question_text: Mi ha detto di ___ tranquillo.
english_translation: He told me to stay calm.
explanation: When reporting a command or instruction, the structure 'dire di + infinitive' is used. The original command 'Stai tranquillo!' becomes '...di stare tranquillo'.

complete_sentence: Ha confessato che aveva sbagliato.
question_text: Ha confessato che ___ sbagliato.
english_translation: He confessed that he had made a mistake.
explanation: When the reporting verb is in the past ('ha confessato'), and the reported action happened before it (original: 'Ho sbagliato'), the tense shifts to the pluperfect indicative (trapassato prossimo), 'aveva sbagliato'.

complete_sentence: Mi ha garantito che sarebbe stato tutto risolto.
question_text: Mi ha garantito che ___ tutto risolto.
english_translation: He assured me that everything would be resolved.
explanation: This reports a future event from a past point of view ('ha garantito'). The original 'Sarà tutto risolto' (future perfect passive) changes to the past conditional passive 'sarebbe stato risolto'.

complete_sentence: Ha negato di conoscere quella persona.
question_text: Ha negato di ___ quella persona.
english_translation: He denied knowing that person.
explanation: After 'negare di' (to deny), the infinitive is used when the subject of both verbs is the same. The original thought was 'Non conosco quella persona'.

complete_sentence: Te lo darò domani.
question_text: ___ lo darò domani.
english_translation: I'll give it to you tomorrow.
explanation: This sentence uses combined pronouns (pronomi combinati). The indirect object pronoun 'ti' (to you) changes to 'te' when placed before the direct object pronoun 'lo' (it).

complete_sentence: Gliene ho parlato ieri.
question_text: ___ ho parlato ieri.
english_translation: I talked to him about it yesterday.
explanation: When the indirect object pronoun 'gli' (to him) is combined with the pronoun 'ne' (about it/of it), they merge to form the single word 'gliene'.

complete_sentence: Me ne compri due?
question_text: ___ ne compri due?
english_translation: Will you buy me two of them?
explanation: The indirect object pronoun 'mi' (for me) changes to 'me' when it precedes the partitive pronoun 'ne' (of them). 'Me ne' means 'two of them for me'.

complete_sentence: Ve lo ve lo spiego subito.
question_text: ___ ve lo spiego subito.
english_translation: I'll explain it to you right away.
explanation: The indirect object pronoun 'vi' (to you, plural) changes to 've' when combined with the direct object pronoun 'lo' (it). 'Ve lo' means 'it to you (all)'.

complete_sentence: Ce li hai portati?
question_text: ___ li hai portati?
english_translation: Did you bring them to us?
explanation: The indirect object pronoun 'ci' (to us) changes to 'ce' when it is placed before direct object pronouns like 'li' (them). 'Ce li' means 'them to us'.

complete_sentence: Non te lo posso lo dire.
question_text: Non ___ lo dire.
english_translation: I can't tell you.
explanation: With a modal verb ('potere'), combined pronouns can either be placed before the conjugated verb ('te lo posso dire') or attached to the end of the infinitive ('posso dirtelo').

complete_sentence: Se se ne è andato senza salutare.
question_text: ___ se ne è andato senza salutare.
english_translation: He left without saying goodbye.
explanation: The pronominal verb 'andarsene' means 'to leave'. It combines the reflexive pronoun 'si' and the particle 'ne'. The 'si' changes to 'se' before 'ne'.

complete_sentence: Te lo te lo restituisco stasera.
question_text: ___ te lo restituisco stasera.
english_translation: I'll return it to you tonight.
explanation: This question tests the understanding of the combined pronouns 'te lo' (it to you), formed from 'ti' (you) and 'lo' (it).

complete_sentence: Voglio dartelo dare subito.
question_text: Voglio ___ dare subito.
english_translation: I want to give it to you immediately.
explanation: When combined pronouns ('ti' becomes 'te' + 'lo') are used with an infinitive ('dare'), they attach to the end, and the infinitive drops its final '-e': 'dare' + 'te' + 'lo' becomes 'dartelo'.

complete_sentence: Sta per dirmelo dire.
question_text: Sta per ___ dire.
english_translation: He's about to tell it to me.
explanation: The combined pronouns 'mi' (becomes 'me') + 'lo' (it) attach to the infinitive 'dire'. The final '-e' of the infinitive is dropped: 'dir' + 'melo' = 'dirmelo'.

complete_sentence: Questo lavoro viene fatto da molte persone.
question_text: Questo lavoro viene ___ da molte persone.
english_translation: This work is done by many people.
explanation: This is a passive sentence using 'venire'. The past participle must agree with the subject. Since 'lavoro' is masculine singular, the participle is 'fatto'.

complete_sentence: La casa è stata costruita l'anno scorso.
question_text: La casa ___ costruita l'anno scorso.
english_translation: The house was built last year.
explanation: This sentence requires the past passive (passato prossimo passivo). It is formed with the present perfect of 'essere' ('è stata') + the past participle ('costruita'), which agrees with the subject 'la casa'.

complete_sentence: Il progetto verrà completato entro domani.
question_text: Il progetto ___ completato entro domani.
english_translation: The project will be completed by tomorrow.
explanation: To express the passive voice in the future, you can use the simple future of 'venire' ('verrà') or 'essere' ('sarà') + the past participle. 'Verrà completato' is a correct future passive form.

complete_sentence: La lettera è stata spedita ieri.
question_text: La lettera ___ spedita ieri.
english_translation: The letter was sent yesterday.
explanation: This sentence is in the past passive (passato prossimo passivo). The subject 'La lettera' is feminine singular, so the auxiliary is 'è stata' and the past participle is 'spedita'.

complete_sentence: I biglietti vengono venduti in prevendita.
question_text: I biglietti ___ venduti in prevendita.
english_translation: The tickets are sold in advance.
explanation: This is the present passive voice. It can be formed with the present tense of 'venire' ('vengono') or 'essere'. The participle 'venduti' agrees with the plural subject 'i biglietti'.

complete_sentence: Il problema può essere risolto facilmente.
question_text: Il problema ___ risolto facilmente.
english_translation: The problem can be solved easily.
explanation: To form the passive with a modal verb ('potere'), the structure is: modal verb + infinitive 'essere' + past participle. 'Può essere risolto' means 'can be solved'.

complete_sentence: La decisione è stata presa dal direttore.
question_text: La decisione ___ presa dal direttore.
english_translation: The decision was made by the director.
explanation: This sentence is in the past passive voice (passato prossimo passivo). The subject 'La decisione' is feminine singular, requiring the auxiliary 'è stata' and the participle 'presa'.

complete_sentence: Tutti i documenti sono stati controllati.
question_text: Tutti i documenti ___ controllati.
english_translation: All documents have been checked.
explanation: This is the past passive (passato prossimo passivo) with a plural subject. The subject 'Tutti i documenti' is masculine plural, so the auxiliary is 'sono stati' and the participle is 'controllati'.

complete_sentence: Le informazioni saranno pubblicate online.
question_text: Le informazioni ___ pubblicate online.
english_translation: The information will be published online.
explanation: This sentence requires the future passive. The subject 'Le informazioni' is feminine plural, so the correct form is the future of 'essere' ('saranno') + the past participle 'pubblicate'.

complete_sentence: La riunione è stata rinviata a domani.
question_text: La riunione ___ rinviata a domani.
english_translation: The meeting has been postponed until tomorrow.
explanation: The sentence requires the past passive (passato prossimo passivo). The subject 'La riunione' is feminine singular, so the auxiliary is 'è stata' and the participle is 'rinviata'.

complete_sentence: Ha fatto una brutta figura alla festa.
question_text: Ha fatto una ___ figura alla festa.
english_translation: He made a bad impression at the party.
explanation: The idiomatic expression 'fare una brutta figura' means 'to make a bad impression'. 'Brutta' is the correct adjective to complete the idiom.

complete_sentence: È andato su tutte le furie quando ha saputo la notizia.
question_text: È andato su tutte le ___ quando ha saputo la notizia.
english_translation: He flew into a rage when he heard the news.
explanation: The idiom 'andare su tutte le furie' means to become extremely angry or to fly into a rage.

complete_sentence: Non sono riuscito a cavare un ragno dal buco.
question_text: Non sono riuscito a cavare un ___ dal buco.
english_translation: I couldn't get anything done.
explanation: The expression 'non cavare un ragno dal buco' is an idiom meaning to accomplish nothing or to fail to get any results from an effort.

complete_sentence: È acqua passata, ora siamo amici.
question_text: È ___ passata, ora siamo amici.
english_translation: It's water under the bridge, now we're friends.
explanation: 'È acqua passata' is the Italian equivalent of the English idiom 'it's water under the bridge', meaning a past conflict is forgotten.

complete_sentence: Su questo argomento non ci piove.
question_text: Su questo argomento non ci ___.
english_translation: There's no doubt about this topic.
explanation: The idiomatic expression 'non ci piove' (literally, 'it doesn't rain on it') means that something is absolutely certain.

complete_sentence: Ha preso un granchio con quella risposta.
question_text: Ha preso un ___ con quella risposta.
english_translation: He made a mistake with that answer.

english_translation: Collaboration is essential for progress.
explanation: 'Collaborazione' is the direct translation for 'collaboration'.

complete_sentence: La solidarietà è un dovere morale.
question_text: La ___ è un dovere morale.
english_translation: Solidarity is a moral duty.
explanation: 'Solidarietà' is the direct translation for 'solidarity'.

complete_sentence: La sostenibilità migliora la qualità della vita.
question_text: La ___ migliora la qualità della vita.
english_translation: Sustainability improves quality of life.
explanation: 'Sostenibilità' is the direct translation for 'sustainability'.

complete_sentence: L'energia rinnovabile è il futuro.
question_text: L'___ rinnovabile è il futuro.
english_translation: Renewable energy is the future.
explanation: 'Energia rinnovabile' is the correct term for 'renewable energy'.

complete_sentence: L'inquinamento dell'aria è pericoloso.
question_text: L'___ dell'aria è pericoloso.
english_translation: Air pollution is dangerous.
explanation: 'Inquinamento dell'aria' is the precise term for 'air pollution'.

complete_sentence: Il riciclaggio dei rifiuti è necessario.
question_text: Il ___ dei rifiuti è necessario.
english_translation: Waste recycling is necessary.
explanation: 'Riciclaggio dei rifiuti' is the correct term for 'waste recycling'.

complete_sentence: La conservazione della natura è urgente.
question_text: La ___ della natura è urgente.
english_translation: Nature conservation is urgent.
explanation: 'Conservazione della natura' is the standard term for 'nature conservation'.

complete_sentence: La transizione ecologica è la soluzione.
question_text: La ___ ecologica è la soluzione.
english_translation: The ecological transition is the solution.
explanation: 'Transizione ecologica' is the current term for 'ecological transition'.

complete_sentence: La economia verde crea lavoro.
question_text: La ___ verde crea lavoro.
english_translation: The green economy creates jobs.
explanation: The term 'green economy' is directly translated as 'economia verde'.

complete_sentence: Il sviluppo sostenibile è possibile.
question_text: Il ___ sostenibile è possibile.
english_translation: Sustainable development is possible.
explanation: 'Sviluppo sostenibile' is the standard, internationally recognized term for 'sustainable development'.

complete_sentence: L'energia solare è economica.
question_text: L'___ solare è economica.
english_translation: Solar energy is economical.
explanation: 'Energia solare' is the correct term for 'solar energy'.

complete_sentence: L'energia eolico è efficiente.
question_text: L'___ eolico è efficiente.
english_translation: Wind power is efficient.
explanation: 'Energia eolica' is the correct term for 'wind power'.

complete_sentence: L'energia idroelettrica è pulita.
question_text: L'___ idroelettrica è pulita.
english_translation: Hydroelectric energy is clean.
explanation: 'Energia idroelettrica' is the correct term for 'hydroelectric energy'.

complete_sentence: L'energia geotermico è promettente.
question_text: L'___ geotermico è promettente.
english_translation: Geothermal energy is promising.
explanation: 'Energia geotermica' is the correct term for 'geothermal energy'.

complete_sentence: L'energia nucleare è controversa.
question_text: L'___ nucleare è controversa.
english_translation: Nuclear energy is controversial.
explanation: 'Energia nucleare' is the correct term for 'nuclear energy'.

complete_sentence: Il risparmio energetico è fondamentale.
question_text: Il ___ energetico è fondamentale.
english_translation: Energy saving is fundamental.
explanation: 'Risparmio energetico' is the standard term for 'energy saving'.

complete_sentence: L'efficienza energetica riduce i costi.
question_text: L'___ energetica riduce i costi.
english_translation: Energy efficiency reduces costs.
explanation: 'Efficienza energetica' is the precise term for 'energy efficiency'.

complete_sentence: La politica energetica è strategica.
question_text: La ___ energetica è strategica.
english_translation: Energy policy is strategic.
explanation: 'Politica energetica' is the correct term for 'energy policy'.

complete_sentence: Il mercato energetico è globale.
question_text: Il ___ energetico è globale.
english_translation: The energy market is global.
explanation: 'Mercato energetico' is the correct term for the 'energy market'.

complete_sentence: La dipendenza energetica è costosa.
question_text: La ___ energetica è costosa.
english_translation: Energy dependence is expensive.
explanation: 'Dipendenza energetica' is the correct political and economic term for 'energy dependence'.

complete_sentence: L'indipendenza energetica è l'obiettivo.
question_text: L'___ energetica è l'obiettivo.
english_translation: Energy independence is the goal.
explanation: 'Indipendenza energetica' is the standard term for 'energy independence'.

complete_sentence: L'energia è una risorsa limitata.
question_text: L'___ è una risorsa limitata.
english_translation: Energy is a limited resource.
explanation: 'Energia' is the correct word for 'energy'.

complete_sentence: La diversificazione delle fonti è necessario.
question_text: La ___ delle fonti è necessario.
english_translation: Diversification of sources is necessary.
explanation: 'Diversificazione delle fonti' is the correct term for the 'diversification of sources', especially in an energy context.

complete_sentence: La sicurezza è una priorità nazionale.
question_text: La ___ è una priorità nazionale.
english_translation: Security is a national priority.
explanation: 'Sicurezza' is the direct translation for 'security'.

complete_sentence: La politica internazionale è complessa.
question_text: La ___ internazionale è complessa.
english_translation: International politics is complex.
explanation: 'Politica internazionale' is the standard term for 'international politics'.

complete_sentence: La diplomazia è fondamentale per la pace.
question_text: La ___ è fondamentale per la pace.
english_translation: Diplomacy is fundamental for peace.
explanation: 'Diplomazia' is the direct translation for 'diplomacy'.

complete_sentence: Il scenario internazionale evolve.
question_text: Il ___ internazionale evolve.
english_translation: The international scenario evolves.
explanation: 'Scenario internazionale' is the correct term for 'international scenario'.

complete_sentence: La cooperazione multilaterale è importante.
question_text: La ___ multilaterale è importante.
english_translation: Multilateral cooperation is important.
explanation: 'Cooperazione multilaterale' is the direct and correct term for 'multilateral cooperation'.

complete_sentence: La negoziazione è uno strumento diplomatico.
question_text: La ___ è uno strumento diplomatico.
english_translation: Negotiation is a diplomatic tool.
explanation: 'Negoziazione' is the direct translation for 'negotiation'.

complete_sentence: Il compromesso è necessario per l'accordo.
question_text: Il ___ è necessario per l'accordo.
english_translation: Compromise is necessary for agreement.
explanation: 'Compromesso' is the direct translation for 'compromise'.

complete_sentence: Il diritto umanitario protegge i civili.
question_text: Il ___ umanitario protegge i civili.
english_translation: Humanitarian law protects civilians.
explanation: 'Diritto umanitario' is the specific legal term for 'humanitarian law'.

complete_sentence: La giustizia è un diritto umano.
question_text: La ___ è un diritto umano.
english_translation: Justice is a human right.
explanation: 'Giustizia' is the direct translation for 'justice'.

complete_sentence: L'uguaglianza è garantita dalla costituzione.
question_text: L'___ è garantita dalla costituzione.
english_translation: Equality is guaranteed by the constitution.
explanation: 'Uguaglianza' is the direct translation for 'equality'.

complete_sentence: Si comporta come se fosse il capo.
question_text: Si comporta come se ___ il capo.
english_translation: He acts as if he were the boss.
explanation: The expression 'come se' (as if) introduces a hypothetical comparison and must be followed by the imperfect subjunctive (congiuntivo imperfetto), 'fosse'.

complete_sentence: Vorrei che tu fossi più attento.
question_text: Vorrei che tu ___ più attento.
english_translation: I would like you to be more careful.
explanation: The verb 'vorrei' (I would like) expresses a desire, requiring the imperfect subjunctive (congiuntivo imperfetto), 'fossi', in the subordinate clause.

complete_sentence: Era l'unica persona che potesse aiutarmi.
question_text: Era l'unica persona che ___ aiutarmi.
english_translation: She was the only person who could help me.
explanation: In a past-tense sentence, a relative clause depending on an expression of uniqueness ('l'unica persona') requires the imperfect subjunctive (congiuntivo imperfetto), 'potesse'.

complete_sentence: Benché fosse stanco, continuò a lavorare.
question_text: Benché ___ stanco, continuò a lavorare.
english_translation: Although he was tired, he continued to work.
explanation: The conjunction 'benché' (although) requires the subjunctive. Since the main verb ('continuò') is in the past, the imperfect subjunctive 'fosse' is used for tense agreement.

complete_sentence: Senza che lui dicesse niente, abbiamo organizzato la festa.
question_text: Senza che lui ___ niente, abbiamo organizzato la festa.
english_translation: Without him saying anything, we organized the party.
explanation: The conjunction 'senza che' requires the subjunctive. As the main action is in the past ('abbiamo organizzato'), the imperfect subjunctive 'dicesse' is needed.

complete_sentence: Credevo che voi foste già partiti.
question_text: Credevo che voi ___ già partiti.
english_translation: I thought that you had already left.
explanation: The main verb 'credevo' is in the imperfect. The subordinate action (leaving) happened before the thinking, so the pluperfect subjunctive (congiuntivo trapassato) 'foste partiti' is required.

complete_sentence: Se lo avessi saputo, te lo avrei detto.
question_text: Se lo ___ saputo, te lo avrei detto.
english_translation: If I had known, I would have told you.
explanation: This is a Type 3 conditional sentence (unreal past). The 'if' clause requires the pluperfect subjunctive (congiuntivo trapassato), 'avessi saputo'.

complete_sentence: Nonostante avesse studiato molto, non passò l'esame.
question_text: Nonostante ___ molto, non passò l'esame.
english_translation: Despite having studied a lot, he didn't pass the exam.
explanation: 'Nonostante' requires the subjunctive. Since the studying occurred before the past action of failing the exam ('passò'), the pluperfect subjunctive (congiuntivo trapassato) 'avesse studiato' is necessary.

complete_sentence: Speravo che l'aereo non fosse arrivato in ritardo.
question_text: Speravo che l'aereo non ___ in ritardo.
english_translation: I was hoping the plane hadn't been delayed.
explanation: The main verb 'speravo' is in the imperfect. The subordinate clause refers to a prior event, thus requiring the pluperfect subjunctive (congiuntivo trapassato), 'fosse arrivato'.

complete_sentence: Se chiamasse, andremmo al cinema.
question_text: ___, andremmo al cinema.
english_translation: Were he to call, we would go to the cinema.
explanation: This is a Type 2 conditional sentence (hypothetical). The structure is 'Se' + imperfect subjunctive ('chiamasse') + present conditional ('andremmo').

complete_sentence: Finiti i compiti, potrai uscire.
question_text: ___ i compiti, potrai uscire.
english_translation: Having finished your homework, you will be able to go out.
explanation: This is an absolute past participle construction. 'Finiti i compiti' means 'Once the homework is finished', with the participle 'finiti' agreeing with 'i compiti'.

complete_sentence: Sorto il sole, la gente uscì in strada.
question_text: ___ il sole, la gente uscì in strada.
english_translation: The sun having risen, people went out into the street.
explanation: This is an absolute past participle construction. 'Sorto il sole' functions as a temporal clause meaning 'After the sun had risen'.

complete_sentence: Leggendo attentamente le istruzioni, montò il mobile.
question_text: ___ attentamente le istruzioni, montò il mobile.
english_translation: Reading the instructions carefully, he assembled the furniture.
explanation: The present gerund ('leggendo') is used to describe an action that happens at the same time as, or just before, the main action.

complete_sentence: Finito il progetto, lo presentarono al capo.
question_text: ___ il progetto, lo presentarono al capo.
english_translation: Having finished the project, they presented it to the boss.
explanation: The past gerund is implied here in the concise form 'Participio Passato + Object'. 'Finito il progetto' is short for 'Avendo finito il progetto', indicating the action was completed before the main action.

complete_sentence: Essendo amici da molti anni, si conoscevano bene.
question_text: ___ da molti anni, si conoscevano bene.
english_translation: Having been friends for many years, they knew each other well.
explanation: The present gerund of 'essere' ('essendo') is used here to express the cause or reason for the action in the main clause.

complete_sentence: Non sapendo la risposta, ho preferito tacere.
question_text: Non ___ la risposta, ho preferito tacere.
english_translation: Not knowing the answer, I preferred to remain silent.
explanation: The gerund 'sapendo' (in its negative form 'non sapendo') explains the reason for the main action ('ho preferito tacere').

complete_sentence: In quel negozio si fanno abiti su misura.
question_text: In quel negozio si ___ abiti su misura.
english_translation: In that shop, custom-made clothes are made.
explanation: This is the passive 'si' (si passivante). Since the object that is 'made', 'abiti' (clothes), is plural, the verb must be in the third-person plural form, 'fanno'.

complete_sentence: Si dice che il prossimo anno sarà difficile.
question_text: Si ___ che il prossimo anno sarà difficile.
english_translation: It is said that next year will be difficult.
explanation: This is the impersonal 'si', used for general statements where the subject is undefined ('one' or 'they'). It is always followed by the third-person singular form of the verb, 'dice'.

complete_sentence: In Italia si mangia molto la pasta.
question_text: In Italia si ___ molto la pasta.
english_translation: In Italy, a lot of pasta is eaten.
explanation: This is the passive 'si'. Since 'la pasta' is grammatically singular, the verb must be in the third-person singular, 'mangia'.

complete_sentence: Non si deve fare rumore dopo le dieci.
question_text: Non si ___ fare rumore dopo le dieci.
english_translation: One must not make noise after ten o'clock.
explanation: The impersonal 'si' with a modal verb ('dovere') requires the singular form of the verb. The structure is 'si + verbo modale (singolare) + infinito'.

complete_sentence: Afferma di non aver visto niente.
question_text: ___ di non aver visto niente.
english_translation: He claims to have seen nothing.
explanation: 'Affermare di' (to claim/state that) is followed by the infinitive when the subject of both verbs is the same. It is a formal way to report a statement.

complete_sentence: Tutti si sono lamentati del ritardo del treno.
question_text: Tutti si sono lamentati ___ ritardo del treno.
english_translation: Everyone complained about the train's delay.
explanation: The verb 'lamentarsi' (to complain) requires the preposition 'di' to introduce the object of the complaint. 'Del' is the articulated preposition 'di + il'.

complete_sentence: Ho insistito perché mi desse una risposta.
question_text: Ho insistito ___ mi desse una risposta.
english_translation: I insisted that he give me an answer.
explanation: The verb 'insistere' can be followed by 'perché' + subjunctive ('mi desse') to mean 'to insist that someone do something'.

complete_sentence: Ti sei ricordato di spegnere la luce?
question_text: Ti sei ricordato ___ spegnere la luce?
english_translation: Did you remember to turn off the light?
explanation: The verb 'ricordarsi' (to remember) is followed by the preposition 'di' when the next word is an infinitive.

complete_sentence: Non riesco a capire cosa volesse dire.
question_text: Non ___ a capire cosa volesse dire.
english_translation: I can't manage to understand what he meant.
explanation: 'Riuscire a + infinito' means 'to manage to' or 'to succeed in' doing something, indicating capability. 'Non riesco a capire' means 'I can't understand'.

complete_sentence: Dai un'occhiata a questo documento, per favore.
question_text: ___ un'occhiata a questo documento, per favore.
english_translation: Take a look at this document, please.
explanation: 'Dare un'occhiata' is the correct idiomatic expression meaning 'to have a look' or 'to glance at'.

complete_sentence: Mio nonno è un uomo d' altri tempi.
question_text: Mio nonno è un uomo ___ altri tempi.
english_translation: My grandfather is a man from another era.
explanation: The expression 'd'altri tempi' (a contraction of 'di altri tempi') means 'old-fashioned' or 'from another time'.

complete_sentence: Alla fine, è venuto fuori ad avere ragione io.
question_text: Alla fine, ___ ad avere ragione io.
english_translation: In the end, it turned out I was right.
explanation: The expression 'è venuto fuori che...' is an idiom meaning 'it turns out that...' or 'it emerged that...'.

complete_sentence: Non riesco a sopportare questo rumore.
question_text: Non riesco a ___ questo rumore.
english_translation: I can't stand this noise.
explanation: 'Sopportare' is the correct verb for 'to stand', 'to bear', or 'to tolerate' something unpleasant.

complete_sentence: L'azienda ha annunciato un taglio del personale.
question_text: L'azienda ha annunciato un ___ del personale.
english_translation: The company announced a staff cutback.
explanation: 'Taglio del personale' is the specific business term for 'staff cuts' or 'layoffs'.

complete_sentence: Bisogna soppesare i pro e i contro prima di decidere.
question_text: Bisogna ___ i pro e i contro prima di decidere.
english_translation: One must weigh the pros and cons before deciding.
explanation: 'Soppesare' is the most precise verb for 'to weigh' pros and cons, used both literally and figuratively.

complete_sentence: Il suo discorso era privo di significato.
question_text: Il suo discorso era ___ di significato.
english_translation: His speech was devoid of meaning.
explanation: 'Privo di' is a formal expression meaning 'devoid of' or 'lacking in'.

complete_sentence: È stata una decisione presa a cuor leggero.
question_text: È stata una decisione presa a ___ leggero.
english_translation: It was a decision taken lightly.
explanation: The idiomatic expression 'a cuor leggero' means to do something 'lightly' or 'without giving it enough thought'.

complete_sentence: Quella questione è ancora un nodo irrisolto.
question_text: Quella questione è ancora un ___ irrisolto.
english_translation: That issue is still an unsolved puzzle.
explanation: 'Nodo' (knot) is used metaphorically to mean a complex, tangled problem or a crucial point that is difficult to resolve.

complete_sentence: Dobbiamo agire con cautela per non fare errori.
question_text: Dobbiamo agire con ___ per non fare errori.
english_translation: We must act with caution so as not to make mistakes.
explanation: 'Cautela' (caution) is the most appropriate noun to express the need for careful action to avoid risks or mistakes.

complete_sentence: Le sue parole hanno suscitato un acceso dibattito.
question_text: Le sue parole hanno suscitato un acceso ___.
english_translation: His words sparked a heated debate.
explanation: 'Dibattito' is the best word for a formal or public 'debate'. 'Discussione' is more general.

complete_sentence: Il governo sta cercando di incentivare la crescita economica.
question_text: Il governo sta cercando di ___ la crescita economica.
english_translation: The government is trying to boost economic growth.
explanation: 'Incentivare' means 'to incentivize' or 'to encourage', a common term used in economics for stimulating growth.

complete_sentence: L'imputato è stato prosciolto da ogni accusa.
question_text: L'imputato è stato ___ da ogni accusa.
english_translation: The defendant was acquitted of all charges.
explanation: 'Prosciolto' is the specific legal term for 'acquitted' or 'absolved'.

complete_sentence: Siamo rimasti colpiti dalla sua generosità.
question_text: Siamo rimasti ___ dalla sua generosità.
english_translation: We were struck by his generosity.
explanation: 'Essere colpiti da' means to be impressed or struck by something. 'Commossi' implies being moved emotionally, often to tears.

complete_sentence: È fondamentale rispettare le scadenze.
question_text: È fondamentale ___ le scadenze.
english_translation: It is essential to meet the deadlines.
explanation: 'Rispettare le scadenze' is the standard and correct expression for 'to meet the deadlines'.

complete_sentence: Questo vino si abbina perfettamente con il pesce.
question_text: Questo vino si ___ perfettamente con il pesce.
english_translation: This wine pairs perfectly with fish.
explanation: The verb 'abbinarsi con' is used specifically to talk about food and wine pairing.

complete_sentence: Ti prego di non travisare le mie parole.
question_text: Ti prego di non ___ le mie parole.
english_translation: Please do not misinterpret my words.
